refnamediv.refpurpose: How to verify that the NSC correctly sets the LUC and brings up apps in the LUC correctly during start-up.

refsect2.title: GDBus
refsect2.para: This test assumes that the gdbus command line tool is installed on the system. Without this application, the LUC tests described here can not be performed.

refsect2.title: Helpful functions
Starting the necessary services
refsect2.para: The NSM dummy and the Node Startup Controller services need to be started prior to running any of the tests described here. This is done using the following commands:
refsect2.programlisting: systemctl start nsm-dummy.service systemctl start node-startup-controller.service

note.para: Check the DLT log after starting these services. If the following messages was logged to the DLT you need to restart node-startup-controller.service:

refsect1.title: Test Cases
refsect1.para: The following test cases for LUC management are described in this document:
refsect1.note: All of these tests need to be executed in the order they are listed here.

refsect2.title: Description
refsect2.para: Registers one application for a single LUC type, restarts the Node Startup Controller and verifies that it attempts to start this app as part of the LUC.

refsect2.title: Test commands
refsect2.programlisting:
begin register "{0: ['app1.unit']}" end
systemctl restart node-startup-controller.service

refsect2.title: Desired behaviour and output
refsect2.para: The DLT log should now contain the following log messages:

refsect1.title: 2. Registration does not happen on an isolated RegisterWithLUC() call

refsect2.title: Description
refsect2.para: Attempts to register an application by calling RegisterWithLUC() all by itself. Restarts the Node Startup Controller and verifies that the last user context hasn't changed.

refsect2.title: Desired behaviour and output
refsect2.para: The DLT log should now contain the following log messages:

refsect1.title: 3. An isolated FinishLUCRegistration() call will not change the LUC

refsect2.title: Description
refsect2.para: Calls FinishLUCRegistration() without having started registration or registered any apps with it. Restarts the Node Startup Controller to verify that the LUC hasn't changed.

refsect2.title: Desired behaviour and output
refsect2.para: The DLT log should now contain the following log messages:

refsect2.title: Description
refsect2.para: Registers the Last User Context with multiple LUC groups and multiple apps in a single LUC group. Restarts the Node Startup Controller to verify the LUC was changed and starts the apps in the correct order.

refsect2.title: Test Commands
refsect2.programlisting:
begin register "{0: ['app1.unit'], 1: ['app1.unit', 'app3.unit'], 2: ['app2.unit']}" end
systemctl restart node-startup-controller.service

refsect2.title: Desired behaviour and Output
refsect2.note: The start order of LUC groups may be different depending on the build-time configuration of the Node Startup Controller in the test system.
refsect2.para: The DLT log should now contain the following messages

refsect1.title: 5. Registration can happen with a series of RegisterWithLUC() calls

refsect2.title: Description
refsect2.para: Registers multiple applications to the LUC in a series of RegisterWithLUC() calls. Restarts the Node Startup Controller and verifies that the apps added in each call are started in the correct order.

refsect2.title: Test commands
refsect2.programlisting:
begin register "{0: ['app1.unit']}" register "{1: ['app3.unit']}" end
systemctl restart node-startup-controller.service

refsect2.title: Desired behaviour and Output
refsect2.para: The DLT log should now contain the following log messages:

refsect1.title: 6. Repeated registration of an app changes the order in the LUC

refsect2.title: Description
refsect2.para: Registers two applications, then registers the first application again. Restarts the Node Startup Controller to verify that the order the applications start is changed by the second registration.

refsect2.title: Test Commands
refsect2.programlisting:
begin register "{1: ['app1.unit', 'app2.unit']}" register "{1: ['app1.unit']}" end
systemctl restart node-startup-controller.service
